Does India hold the potential to become next Economic Superpower? Elaborate with facts.

Yes, India does hold the potential to become the next economic superpower.Following are the reasons behind it:

1) India's GDP growth rate is 5.5% during 2011-12.recent budget mentioned the 4.5% growth rate, just to curb the recession phinomena, but still we have a high hope that it would definitely grows to the extent of 8.1% in years to come

2)India's industrial production is around 1.941 thrillen, production & services are the major denominator for making any economy wide and huge and put forward the potential of that particular country in the world for the competition,During the time of recession as well India never faced the situation of employment loss,it stick to its potential to serve the nation.

3)India's FII inflows raised from the previous years that gives the light on the potential of the country worth on the map of the world.

4)India's economic growth is mainly depends on the population and how to use this human resource effectively is the main important factor that derives the worth of any nation.innovations and developments are happening in rural sector as well to improve the education system there even technological advancements are happening there to imporve the livelihood of rural areas.Even India is aware of maintaining and improvise the system of agriculture for the enhancement of productions of agri products.

This is the main reasons for the India's growth prospects, many other innovations have been there and will happen in future likewise recent developments happened in defence & automic energy. Indian government is always there to boost the policy framework and all.
